title: Berlin's dangerous fascination with homemade firecrackers and fireworks
subhed: Police unions and doctors' associations are calling for a ban on the private use of pyrotechnic devices, which cause injuries every New Year's Eve. But the German capital defends its libertarian spirit and its festive reputation.

title: Banana growers in the French Antilles try to move past legacy of chlordecone
subhed: Producers in Martinique and Guadeloupe have significantly reduced their use of pesticides over the past decade, but the extra costs of new agricultural practices threaten the viability of their farms as they face competition from Latin American bananas.

title: Fine champagnes at affordable prices: Le Monde's selection of the best bubbles for the holiday season
subhed: Rémi Barroux, Stéphane Davet, Laure Gasparotto and Sébastien Jenvrin tasted 181 non-vintage champagnes, known as 'brut sans année,' each priced at no more than €50. They selected 81, from both major champagne houses and independent winemakers.

title: Mariupol, Ukraine: A model city of 'new Russia'
subhed: Since 2015, photographer Gabriele Micalizzi has been documenting the Donbas region from the Russian side of the front line, an area where Moscow enforces very strict access conditions for journalists. In November, he secured permission to enter Donetsk Oblast, a region of occupied Ukraine, and traveled to Mariupol, a city destroyed by Russian forces in 2022, which has since been colonized and rebuilt in record time.
